text: today on x cast the house ethics
committee finds charles Rangel guilty of
ethics violations President Obama Awards
the Medal of Honor to a living soldier a
first since the Vietnam War and a look
at apple's announcement today
Sam representative charlie rangel has
now been convicted on most of the
charges by this house ethics panel what
does this mean for him immediately well
what it means is that the full panel
will now deliberate on a penalty
recommended to the House of
Representatives which then has to vote
on that penalty the most likely penalty
is probably going to be some form of
reprimand or censure they could also
find him they could also somehow reduce
his privileges in the house one highly
unlikely alternative is expulsion that
would take a two-thirds vote of the full
house and that seems pretty far-fetched
at this point okay so representative
Rangel probably won't be kicked out of
the house as you say but what are the
possible repercussions for him
politically with Congress and in his
home district well I think Congress
would like to see a little bit of
contrition but remember congressman
Rangel is now going into a Congress in
which the Democrats are now in the
minority he has already lost his
chairmanship of the House Ways and Means
Committee something that he had coveted
in many of his years in the House of
Representatives and back home he was
just re-elected this month to a full
two-year term by his district presumably
his last term if he retires he is 80
years old he served 40 years in the
house and keep in mind that his
predecessor the man he beat Adam Clayton
Powell when the House of Representatives
refused to seat him in 1967 Powell went
back at a special election ran and won
this district tends to be forgiving on
Tuesday afternoon Staff Sergeant Sal
junta becomes the first living soldier
to receive the Medal of Honor since the
Vietnam War it's the highest military
award in the country in 2007 New York
Times Magazine contributing reporter
Elizabeth Ruben was embedded with juntas
company in afghanistan's Korengal Valley
when a Taliban ambush killed his friend
and fellow soldier Josh Brennan who
always insisted on walking at the front
of his platoon we were spread out across
the mountain and then we could hear them
screaming over the radio we need help
five men down
genta is with some other guys he gets
hit and he realizes Brennan isn't there
and he runs into the dark to find
Brennan who's being taken off by Taliban
and he shoots the Taliban and he runs to
Brennan to try and save his life Brennan
was badly wounded in the jaw and like
six or seven gunshot wounds and they
started dressing him they called for a
medevac then this hoist came out of the
sky at medevac poison and took him away
the next morning I went up to the opie
to find Jinta already at that time he
knew that they were putting him up for
the Medal of Honor and he was very
conflicted and and basically angry about
it because this award this medal comes
at the expense of three men's lives
Larry rugal Hugo Mendoza Josh Brennan
they were all killed during Rock
avalanche he didn't feel like a hero he
felt like an ordinary soldier who just
ran to find his friend today Apple
announced that after years of
negotiations itunes is now selling
Beatles music so apple's announcement
today it's not the iphone 5 in terms of
you know the relative scale of apple's
announcements it's pretty small I think
it's a symbolic victory for Apple if
nothing more I mean it's important to
them it's important for Steve Jobs who's
been a big sort of public Beatles fan
for a long long time now and I think
probably you know having exclusive
rights to the biggest selling music act
of all time on your digital platform is
something that they can be very excited
about amusing you know for PR purposes
and the dispute between Apple and EMI
the Beatles record labels been going on
for some 30 years oh yeah it goes back
almost to the founding of Apple computer
which had to basically get permission
from apple core which was the Beatles
company that administered their record
label to use the name Apple and the
agreement they came to back then funnily
enough said fine you can be called Apple
Computer you just can't really be
involved in the music business so the
Beatles is one of the biggest selling
bands of all time I mean how much money
will this make apple probably not all
that much right I mean itunes doesn't
really make apple a lot of money on its
own itunes is probably a break-even
business and it exists so that more
people will buy ipods and iphones those
things make a lot of money for
but selling music itself not a really
big deal join us again tomorrow four
times cast
